intro: Matelea gonocarpos, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a climbing habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Matelea gonocarpos is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
